summary:
💫As a bioengineer with nearly 10 years of experience in the biotechnology and pharmaceutical sectors, I have honed my skills in process development, analytical chemistry, and troubleshooting complex problems. From medical devices to biologics, I am passionate about finding innovative solutions to manufacturing and analytical development challenges!



ACHIEVEMENTS
🧪 Played a pivotal role as the analytical lead for a preclinical ADC program, successfully managing all facets of analytical development, transfer, and qualification (pre-validation).

🚀 Delivered extensive technical support to both internal and external team members, demonstrating my ability to handle complex projects, new concepts, and competing priorities with finesse.

🧬 Served as SME in sustaining efforts for a $2 billion sequencing consumables portfolio, ensuring continuous production, high-quality releases, adherence to cGMP, maintenance of validated state, and timely shipments.

📈 Identified and addressed a CAPA for progressively degenerating chromatography results that had a growing impact on manufacturing schedules, leading the investigation in partnership with a cross-functional group of experts and implementing solutions to directly mitigate the root cause.

🤖 Achieved hands-free automation for 80% of cell culture process handling in a 900-plate inventory by developing an automated liquid handling platform as part of a multidisciplinary team. The outcomes were minimized contamination risks and bolstered downstream assay robustness.

RECCOMENDATIONS
"As her manager for nearly 4 years, I greatly appreciated her go-get, ambitious attitude. She often volunteered to take on extra tasks or work that just needed to get done to move programs forward. She never shied away from a new challenging task! Karen was a pillar on our analytical team, someone whom everyone could lean on and trust." - Heather Dorthé, direct manager at Rakuten Medical, 2024

"I highly recommend Karen for any position that requires her leadership or scientific proficiency. She will exceed your expectations and bring positive energy to your organization." - Trung Nguyen, colleague at Rakuten Medical, 2024

"Karen is a highly capable engineer who picks up new manufacturing processes and technology quickly. Karen is customer focused and is a strong team player. She collaborates strongly across teams and delivers quality work." David O'Brien, manager at Illumina, 2019
geoRegion: San Diego County, California, United States

projects.description: Developed a Linux-based virtual cluster optimized to work with the UCSF DOCK application. This system was deployed onto the Pacific Rim Applications and Grid Middleware Assembly (PRAGMA) cloud. This created a time efficient and consistent environment on which large-scale molecular docking simulations can be executed.
projects.title: Deployment of a Virtual Cluster for Molecular Docking Experiments on the PRAGMA Cloud

projects.description: Progressive Supranuclear Palsy (PSP) is often misdiagnosed as Parkinson’s disease (PD). The method physicians currently use to diagnose patients involves subjectively looking at a patient’s eye while running slow and rapid eye movement tests. The system created through this project uses a low cost eye tracking device and software to quantify the diagnosis of PSP, resulting in a more standardized diagnosis. Precision and accuracy of measuring horizontal saccade amplitude, velocity, and latency was tested to determine the robustness of the system. It has been found that through this system, fast, accurate, and inexpensive diagnosis of PSP can be performed.
projects.title: Device for Quantitative Analysis of Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

headline: Driving Biotech innovation with my process optimization skills and analytical chemistry knowledge. Let's connect!
